thread.title: UMass talking points: Is Mark Whipple worried about how his team will react to another bad loss?
thread.title_full: UMass talking points: Is Mark Whipple worried about how his team will react to another bad loss?

author: Daniel Malone | Special to MassLive
title: UMass talking points: Is Mark Whipple worried about how his team will react to another bad loss?
text:
Comments 
AMHERST â€“ Here are a few things that stood out from postgame interviews with University of Massachusetts coach Mark Whipple, Blake Frohnapfel and Jovan Santos-Knox following the Minutemen's 15-10 loss to Kent State Saturday. 
Naturally, Whipple was asked if he's concerned about yet another frustrating loss having an effect on the locker room: 
"Yeah, I always worry about that. They're kids but they're resilient. This was a big game, no question. They were all right in the locker room and we'll get back to work on Monday afternoon. We've got a great Toledo team coming in and that's all we can do." 
Blake Frohnapfel was also asked about how the team can keep things from unraveling. With a top-25 team coming to town next week and half the season already gone, he spoke mostly of urgency: 
"It's disappointing and you never want to lose a game like that. Sitting down in the locker room, we're talking about the chance we have against Toledo next week. They're a ranked team. They come here and play us at Gillette and we have a great opportunity. It's a great challenge. For a lot of the guys on our team, this is the last time we'll play football. It's like, why get discouraged? You have to be optimistic about the season. Toledo will be a great challenge, but I think it's one we're excited for. They're a great team. They're a top 25 team. They definitely do a lot of things well. But it's a chance to come back. 
Jovan Santos-Knox, who is usually pretty outspoken, but didn't have a whole lot to say in Saturday's postgame, felt similarly: 
"I'm not worried about that. We have strong guys in that locker room. We've had tough losses here over the past years and we've always bounced back and kept spirits up in the locker room. I'm not worried about that. We have resilient guys. We should be good." Blake Frohnapfel & Jovan Santos-Knox Talk After UMass' Loss To Kent State The quarterback and linebacker share their thoughts on the 15-10 loss Saturday. 
Whipple, an avid golfer during the offseason, went into some golf terminology to describe the uphill battle UMass was fighting for most of the evening: 
"The game played out the way they wanted it to play out. We couldn't make a big play to get us something and it was just kind of a rain day today. Hitting a tee ball sideways. It's hard to score. A couple of hooks and a few slices and you can still make par, make birdie, but it's a lot harder."
